stream_context.summary: Kaze brainstorms and prototypes the final main stage (Course 15 – a giant ‘space arcade’ inside a rocket) while play-testing Biobak’s re-worked Bomb-Cap factory level.  Half the stream is pure design ideation (star layout, colour palette, mini-games); the other half is deep debugging – trimming collision maps, chasing crashes, and discovering a Fast64 texture-export bug.

development_findings.summary: Mario’s entire animation system was ‘overhauled’ to make all animations behave more consistently at code level.
development_findings.quote: I overhauled Mario's animation system. Mario's animations are now much more consistent.

development_findings.summary: Course 15 theme settled: a rocket-shaped space arcade with six stars and three hidden Yoshi-stars.  Interior will have a spiral shaft over a black-hole void.

Planned stars for Course 15: 1) climb outside rocket; 2) Whack-a-Mole machine; 3) Rhythm-game machine; 4) Skee-ball via cannon leading to slide; 5) Red-coin ‘pinball in space’ inspired by Sonic’s Casino Night; 6) Bit-pipe that jumps through stylised fragments of classic Mario 64 levels.
development_findings.quote: I think the contrast between Mario 64 levels and RTYI levels is going to be beautiful at display here.

development_findings.summary: Decision: all heavy retro references will be isolated inside bit-pipes so they don’t ‘bleed’ into normal levels.
development_findings.quote: I kind of like that all the references of old Mario games are contained within the bit pipes. I don't want them to bleed into the rest of the game.

development_findings.summary: Explored colour/lighting for Course 15; darkening the skybox immediately made neon effects pop, but palette is still ‘poopy’ and unsolved.
Planned environmental set-pieces: huge CRTs you can walk on; rainbow-road-style slides; ugly arcade carpets; low-gravity boxes that halve gravity.
Technical effect R&D: tried additive ‘renders-before-geometry’ overlay; considering model-matrix depth tricks; currently looks ‘kind of ass’.
Fast64 exporter bug discovered: 32×128 wall texture repeats twice in-game unless UV shifted; Kaze will file bug report.
development_findings.quote: Definitely a Fast64 bug, right? I'm not insane here.

development_findings.summary: Factory/Bomb-Cap level crash traced to actor/collision overflow; trimmed collision from ~8 000 to ~3 900 triangles and raised RAM actor cap in code.
Seven-segment LED timer, overhead ceiling light source, catwalk replacements, bomb-dropping treadmills and bombable tutorial wall added to Bomb-Cap stage.

context_findings.summary: Kaze refused a pushy ISP who installed hardware before contract signing, framing it as standing up to dishonesty.
context_findings.quote: They installed it before I signed the contract. I'm not paying for that. Go pick it up, idiot.

context_findings.summary: He views making one’s bed and listening to classical music as identity signalling rather than productivity or intelligence.
context_findings.quote: Making your bed is not a productive people thing. That's an identity thing for people who want to feel productive.

context_findings.summary: Reflects on childhood vs adult patience in games; now demands that ‘optimal’ play is also fun.
context_findings.quote: As a kid I didn't consider a game something you got to play but rather something you had to beat.

context_findings.summary: Mentions Monday–Tuesday off work, implying flexible schedule and possible bonus streams.

biobak.summary: Submitted major Bomb-Cap level pass: cut 2 000 polys, consolidated materials, rounded pillars, converted wall gears, added catwalks, seven-segment timer, ceiling light concept, graffiti & bomb icon.
biobak.quote: There's an absolute garbage topology in there for lighting reasons and somehow it's still 2 000 fewer polygons.

biobak.summary: Proposed giant rocket-casino visual (basis of Course 15 theme).

zeina.summary: Primarily appears in chat; Kaze jokes about her making the bed – light evidence of personal/professional overlap.
zeina.quote: Zaina sometimes makes the bed and every time she makes the bed it's like you made it worse.

key_stories.title: Shaping the Space Arcade
key_stories.summary: Kaze needs a spectacular final level.  Brainstorms with chat: a neon rocket arcade full of mini-games and a nostalgia bit-pipe. He struggles with colour palette and platform ideas but locks in the six-star structure.
key_stories.challenge: Create a climactic stage that feels fresh, mechanically dense, and visually coherent.
key_stories.process: Rapid design notes on stream: listing star concepts, debating retro references, testing colour+lighting tweaks.
key_stories.outcome: Final structure and thematic pillars agreed; visual palette still open.
key_stories.key_quote: This is the best idea – a giant rocket that's the casino... the contrast with Mario 64 chunks is going to be beautiful.

key_stories.title: Bomb-Cap Factory Rework
key_stories.summary: Biobak submits a lighter, prettier factory map.  Kaze integrates it, but the game crashes.  Through collision trimming, actor-count checks and texture debugging, he inches toward stability.
key_stories.challenge: Level crashed on load due to collision and actor overflow.
key_stories.process: Remove suspect objects, shrink collision map, raise RAM limits, discover Fast64 texture bug, iterate tests.
key_stories.outcome: Level now loads with pared-down collision; final crash source still under investigation but isolated to certain objects.
key_stories.key_quote: If this doesn't fix it, we are in shit – then there is some kind of weird thing going on.

key_stories.title: ISP Router Standoff
key_stories.summary: An ISP installed new hardware without a signed contract; Kaze refused to sign or pay, leaving the router in his basement.
key_stories.challenge: Pushy sales rep attempted to bind him to worse internet.
key_stories.process: Declined signature, let them waste time & equipment.
key_stories.outcome: No contract, no payment; Kaze frames it as a victory against dishonesty.
key_stories.key_quote: I'm not signing shit. They dropped their router in our basement – jokes on him.
